content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: nice puzzle... i think medium might be better, but easy is oke too.... the instructions are straightforward and all the test cases looks good

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice twist on Tic-tac-toe!
Solved in 14 lines

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice easy puzzle with a nice twist on classic Tic-tac-toe. Some redundancy in the statement and contraints but it's clear enough to understand on first read.  

I'd love to show you my C# code, I think you'd learn a thing or two about .Net and C# that would make future solutions a lot simpler. I did it in 17 lines.

A few points I noticed and suggestions:

Perhaps Tic-Tac-Toe reads slightly easier to read than TicTacToe?

Is there a reason for the empty {{ }} in the second sentence? "You are also given the state of a TicTacToe game, where {{ }} (space) means..." - If you're trying to use space as a constant, it doesn't appear, just having (space) is fine I think.

Third sentence has: "The winning path must be 'at least' [[g]] cells long" but the constraint and results are exactly [[g]] spaces. - I suppose technically it's correct but might be worth just changing to exactly [[g]] for consistency.

Consider changing the list of winning paths to be bullet points for easier reading, e.g.
The winning path will be represented using the characters:
• {{-}} (if the winning path is in a row)
• {{|}} (if the winning path is ... etc.

(Note: these are just suggestions - feel free to disregard if you disagree)
I hope you received enough feedback from the community to improve your contribution. Once you have made the necessary updates, publish your contribution!

Difficulty
* Suggest to set the difficulty as Easy.

Statement/Input/Output
* Generally speaking, please include technical details of what the input/output is like in Input/Output sections instead of in Goal section. I will give you more specific comments below.

Goal
* Please change the first sentence as:
On input, you are given two integers: [[n]] for the size of the TicTacToe board, and [[g]] for the minimum number of cells required for a winning path.

* Second sentence: Please change "These n lines will represent a" to "You are also given the".

* Last sentence of first paragraph: Please add "cells occupied by the same player" before "in a row".

* First sentence of second paragraph: Please change "On the output, there will be n lines with" to "Your task is to output two things. The first output is".

* Please change "The next line" to "The second output is the result, which".

* Please add a "." to each of the two fixed output phrases ({{X.}} / {{O.}} instead of {{X}} / {{O}}).

Input
* Please rewrite as follows:
<<Line 1:>> Two space-separated integers [[n]] and [[g]] for the size of the TicTacToe board, and the minimum number of cells required for a winning path respectively
<<Next [[n]] lines:>> Each line contains [[n]] characters for the state of one row of the TicTacToe board

Output
* Please rewrite the first line as follows:
<<[[n]] lines:>> The TicTacToe board updated with the winning path (if applicable)

Cover picture
* Suggest to upload a cover picture for the puzzle.

Thanks.

I don't know if a difficulty is ok and what tags I should give this exercise.
I'd love to hear your suggestions!

Thanks for suggestions.
* I've removed "{{ }}", as you are correct - it won't be visible and "(space)" should be clear enough.
* I've removed "at least" from "The winning path must be at least [[g]] cells long" and
* "minimum" from "the minimum number of cells required for a winning path".
* I've reformated the statement, using bullet points and empty lines to make it easier to read.
I don't think it's necessary to change "TicTacToe" to "Tic-Tac-Toe".
